item.title: Review: Fahrenheit 451
item.description: Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury 451F: Temperature at which book-paper catches fire and burns. Enter a dystopia where firemen are responsible for burning books rather than preventing houses from fires - in both cases, the firemen are the custodians of peace, saving people from potential “dangers”. Recommended for: Anyone who doesn’t read regularly. Characters: Guy Montag Clarrise McClellan Mildred Captain Beatty Faber This is a story of Montag, a fireman, awakening to the reality of world he is living in (similar to that of Winston in 1984).

item.title: Reading List 2019
item.description: Heading into 2019, I aim to read a lot of books across genres - from historical fictions to the latest genetics developments, from philosophy about human societies to the realities of individual emotions. Over the weekend, I updated my Goodreads shelves and downloaded a lot of “Samples” on my Kindle from the Amazon Store. My intention is to read these preview chapters at random on my Kindle and dive into only those books which interest me.
